Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged
Hashtag added: redfish-updateservice-use-dbus

Getting the following error:
```
Oct 04 18:24:16 p10bmc phosphor-usb-code-update[960]: Exception occurred for GetAssociatedSubTreePaths for /xyz/openbmc_project/software/bmc/functional: method: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.InvalidArgs: Invalid arguments 'ssias' to call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper.GetAssociatedSubTreePaths(), expecting 'ooias'.
Oct 04 18:24:16 p10bmc phosphor-usb-code-update[960]: Failed to find associated functional path
```

I tried changing the variables to an object_path:
```
| -    constexpr auto associatedPath =
| -        "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/bmc/functional";
| -    constexpr auto subTree = "/xyz/openbmc_project/software";
| +    sdbusplus::message::object_path associatedPath(
| +        "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/bmc/functional");
| +    sdbusplus::message::object_path subTree("/xyz/openbmc_project/software");
```

But strangely still get the same error.
Can you please verify again. I have updated the interface name.

Got the busctl command working with "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Activation":

```
root@p10bmc:~# dbus-send --system --print-reply \
--dest=xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper \
/xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper \
xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper.GetAssociatedSubTree \
objpath:"/xyz/openbmc_project/software/bmc/functional" \
objpath:"/xyz/openbmc_project/software" int32:0 array:string:"xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Activation"
```

It returns:
```
method return time=1729710057.213083 sender=:1.33 -> destination=:1.599 serial=6315 reply_serial=2
   array [
      dict entry(
         string "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/e44bebbd"
         array [
            dict entry(
               string "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Manager"
               array [
                  string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable"
                  string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer"
                  string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Common.FilePath"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Compatible"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Activation"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.ExtendedVersion"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.RedundancyPriority"
                  string "xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version"
               ]
            )
         ]
      )
   ]
```

Looking at bmcweb, they use a get property to get the functional association, it seems that'd be simpler than querying for the whole subtree:

```
root@p10bmc:~# busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/software/bmc/functional xyz.openbmc_project.Association endpoints
as 1 "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/e44bebbd"
```

bmcweb makes the get property call here: https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/d8f8a7d77e0fc3aabcf86eed1eb4ed57dfc241d3/redfish-core/include/utils/sw_utils.hpp#L96

Could you replace the subtree call with a `utils::getProperty` call? This usb file already uses this API for some other property value.

Is there any specific reason we should swap out with utils::getProperty?
Are you running into some issue with get_associated_sub_tree_paths? 
I see utils::getProperty again does a reverse lookup from bus to first figure out the service name and then makes a calls for getProperty. If there is no strong reasoning for change, then isn't current flow better since it involves a single DBus call? Please let me know.
Done, used utils::getProperty.
